alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 25 at 9:16PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Curry County in southwestern Oregon, including Brookings, Gold Beach, the US 101 corridor, and all area drainages. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, and could also result in rockfalls and landslides. Area creeks and streams are running high and could rise out of their banks or flood with more heavy rain. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy and steady rainfall will begin Friday morning and continue through Saturday evening. The heaviest rainfall is expected from Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Excessive rainfall on already saturated soils, leading to increased runoff into already high rivers, creeks, and streams. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches are forecast over a period of 42 hours. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
